title: Boosters Staying Classy Despite End of Season Pressures...
body:

Anyone 'daring' to play past 20 minutes of their, botted, scripted, cheated and toxic games will get something like this: (because they are busy people! they got to crank out those boosts! like an assembly line!)

From not only them , but their bots as well. (which in case you don't know, are probably just 2 accounts open in separate windows.)

After the game, the INTENTIONALLY FEEDING/LEAVING TURRET FOR NO REASON/PARTIALLY BOTTED {{champion:420}}  posted this inspirational and constructive feedback in the post match lobby:

http://i.imgur.com/novVNw1.jpg

Riot Support Please Learn the Difference. They are literally laughing in your faces, with these seemingly absurd, but apparently effective techniques at obfuscating their own trolling and toxicity. 


P.s. thanks for the free skin

The amount of people reporting you is not considered, just whether or not you were reported, and your review if one is triggered is not biased by context. You are only held accountable for what you did, and they are held accountable for what they did. Basically, don't say anything if you aren't saying something productive or nice, leave stuff like "these guys are cheating" for the report text box.

Also, typically it is done by an automated system, although manual reviews do occur.
I guess mentioning the fact that there is no legal system in the world which isolates and passes judgements on behavior in this manner. i.e. minus any sort of context.

> [{quoted}](name=Troll Armada,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lbmUYKnr,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-02T16:49:32.848+0000)
>
> I guess mentioning the fact that there is no legal system in the world which isolates and passes judgements on behavior in this manner. i.e. minus any sort of context.

Things that you can get banned for in this game are not acceptable in any context. Give me an example of one that is?

well of course, some of these kids come here and post their chat log responses full of racist/sexist terminology, and yes that's a valid ban, however, in general, normal people are going to from time to time 'crack' and at the very least passive aggressively respond to troll team, and those should not earn players chat restrictions.

I know this happens, because I've gotten one before. 

i.e. entire team AND YOUR OWN IN A RANKED GAME full of cheats/trolls and you get punishment.


So, I'm just assuming the system won't look for things like, "oh look, yes, the ENTIRE TEAM **DOES** appear to be using scripots/bots/cheats, but this summoner is still punished for being troxic..." as long as trolls stay "positive" their in game context of pure unadulterated cheating/feeding/throwing is not taken into consideration.

It does not matter who is on your team, being passive aggressive towards them is only going to make the situations worse and make everyone's time in the game less enjoyable. In this context, what you are doing is against the terms of service and punishable. You say that normal people are going to crack from time to time, but most people don't get punished and if that is all it takes to get banned then normal people don't do that.

And, again, it does not matter how many people report you in a game, it only counts as being reported in one game. 20 reports in 5 games? That is 5 games you were reported in, not 20 reports against you.

Again that's absurd and doesn't even remotely take into account the nature of low elo matches, in which the troll/botter/boughtaccounts/streamertrolls/scripters literally outnumber nornal players.

Cheat scripts posts various "strategic" and "positive/happy" messages in game, whcih riot never notices HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH ANYTHING ACTUALLY OCCURING IN THE GAME.

We can safely assume that especially in low elo, valid reports are often treated as invalid reports due to riot support staff/absurdly simplistic algorithms inability to identify real trolling.

I report almost every game in low elo, and my reports are probably worthless, even thought I'm filing valid reports, system probably sees them as invalid, because it can't ascertain nuance.

People are naturally reacting to toxicity both obvious and passive aggressive in a human manner. Most people have no knowledge of the many ways trolls abuse the system. For example bots which are programmed to DO NOTHING other than run to real player and take all CS / and KS and then run back to doing nothing. This is percieved by riot as 'bad game.

Have you thought that maybe the reason that all of the botters, bought accounts, trolls, and scripters are in low elo is because they are getting banned before they get very far?

There are people posting on these forums all the time saying that they got banned for all of that stuff. Less so trolls and bought accounts, because they know what they did and can't try to defend it. They still show up though. Your reports are helping, you just don't feel the impact of them because nothing is happening to you.
